title: Worlds Rising: A look back at the Season 1 Championship

replies.body: Oh man...has Riot Games even looked at BlizzCon? This is so puny compared to BlizzCon :P
*as Blizzard limps to the finish line with its own inferior MOBA 3 years later*
Well, without Blizzard League would most likely not exist, at least not in its current state.

that said, besides the initial groundwork and mechanics, Blizzard itself really didn't have anything to do with developing the game. At that point, it was up to the online community to make the blizzard tools work for the game they wanted to make.
not to mention blizzcon is nothing compared to league now. worlds vastly out scales blizzcon.
dude half of the staff came from blizzard

Not to mention the fact that the company is a mere shadow of the Blizzard that actually cared about making quality games ahead of their time. Now the best they can settle for is regurgitating and rehashing others ideas into a inferior product.
That's what they were saying in the article, Season 1 was tiny.

Nostalgia really... I remember when people kept telling me that this game would be forgotten but instead it ends up being one of the world's most popular game. I like that Riot is doing well but I kind of miss the casual play that it used to have.
FILTHY CASUAL
Aww wittle baby League <3
Riot, can you please think of Ranked Team Builder?
or at least choosing your role, I hate having pick arguements in ranked (or really anywhere)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WYT-tSz2T60  {{champion:9}}  Surprise Matafkers
Who is the shirtless guy with fnatic?
thats sushei
I remember the days of broken lifesteal. I would go AD teemo and sit 1v3 healing so much from my lifesteal that i couldn't be killed. One wolf would lifesteal me from no hp to full.
Required Dodge... I remember BloodThirster/FrostMallet/PhantomDancer Mordekaiser!
first
Zed is #1 {{champion:238}}
{{champion:157}} Please child...
The only thing yasuo is good for is the highest lose rate, and me having to ban him from teammates.
lol? Get off brazillian servers and join the rest of the world where he's good.
"The first time I saw OddOne, I thought he was going to be this tough-looking chain-smoker because his voice was really deep"  (You forgot your Kappa)

The last time a tournament was fun for the players, is also the only time a non Asian team won it. {{item:2040}}
ay

A while ago, around when Worlds started this year, I took a look back at the Season 1 tournament. I've found there is no greater exercise in perspective.
AP Carry Alistar, serious talk of Swain in the first few rotations, Malzahar in the top lane, Anivia played seriously by someone other than Froggen.
Oh the times, they are a changin'.

Man I still bust out Anivia when I'm feeling Froggen..... Ahem.  Froggy. Granted I'm not a pro, but she's probably the only mid champion I'm comfortable picking into the assassin meta we've kinda got going on. And I say kinda because the Syndra and Xerath so strong right now.
